text: HIV Drug Resistance Database, also named Stanford HIV RT and Protease Sequence Database is a database at Stanford University that shows 93 versions of HIV. The latest list uses data from other laboratories in Europe, Canada and the United States including more than 15,000 pieces of data.Physorg:New Stanford list of HIV mutations vital to tracking AIDS epidemic ==Further reading== * HIV Drug Resistance Database ==Related pages == * Cystic Fibrosis (CF) * Infectious agent * List of infectious diseases ==References== Category:HIV/AIDS
title: HIV Drug Resistance Database
